## Description {#details}

This class represents an efficient way to signal success or failure.

It should be preferred over the use of <code>bool</code> when appropriate, as it avoids all of the ambiguity that arises in interpreting a boolean result. This class is marked as NODISCARD to ensure that the result is processed. Users may explicitly discard a result by using <code>(void)</code>, e.g. <code>(void)functionThatReturnsALogicalResult();</code>. Given the intended nature of this class, it generally shouldn&#39;t be used as the result of functions that very frequently have the result ignored. This class is intended to be used in conjunction with the utility functions below.

Definition at line 25 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/logicalresult-h">LogicalResult.h</a>.
